text: France has always been one of the favorite tourist places to visit
Not only in Europe but also all over the world!
Here, you will find many options to get to know
And enjoy an incredible vacation.
It is a nation full of history,
dreamy landscapes,
and unique gastronomy!
Of course, it is also the country of fashion
and the most exquisite wines you can taste.
The list is endless
So, grab your bags and surrender yourself to the pleasure you will feel
In this beautiful European nation.
This is  the list of the ten tourist places you should not miss on your next trip to France
No. 1 Paris
One of the things you must do on your next trip to France is to visit its capital.
Paris is the world center of fashion, gastronomy, and culture.
This city is home to the Eiffel Tower,
the Gothic cathedral of Notre Dame
The National Palace of Les Invalides,
the Latin Quarter,
the Palace of Versailles, and others.
All of them, many known around the world.
To get around the city, you have many options.
No.2 Eiffel Tower (Paris)
The Eiffel Tower is one of the famous sites of France and the capital
It is a must-see place if you come to Paris or even Europe!
Located at the end of the Champ de Mars on the banks of the Seine River
The Eiffel Tower is the tallest structure in the city, measuring 324 meters high.
It was built in 1889.
Design by the engineer Gustave Eiffel.
It is the obligatory stop during your trip to Paris
Because this building is the most renowned Worldwide
And of course one of the tourist sites par excellence.
It has about 7.1 million visitors per year!
Climbing to the top of the Eiffel tower will give you the best views of Paris
And  it also has elevators, stores, antennas, and restaurants!
The Eiffel tower a must stop when you're in france
No. 3 Louvre Museum (Paris)
If you are an art lover, you have to go to the Louvre Museum in Paris.
This museum houses 445000 works in total!
Among the collections are Oriental, Egyptian, Greek
Etruscan, Roman antiquities, Islamic arts and others
It also has archaeological and decorative arts
As well as collections dating back several years.
It is the largest art museum in the world and the most famous.
It has works of great renown: La Gioconda by Leonardo Da Vinci if one of them.
The museum was inaugurated in 1793,
Making it one of the oldest tourist sites in Paris.
No. 4  Bordeaux
During your stay in France, you cannot miss the opportunity to visit Bordeaux.
A city located southeast of the country
Capital of New Aquitaine, and sixth largest entity in France.
In this city, you will find many World Heritage Sites declared by UNESCO
Places like: The Port of the Moon and the Basilica of Saint Michel.
You can also visit the theater of Bordeaux
The most important of the European nations
As well as the Basilica of Saint Severin, the museum of Aquitaine, and much more.
You can also hike along the Garonne River
And stroll through the 117,514 hectares of vineyards.
For this reason, Bordeaux is a beautiful destination in the south of France.
No. 5 Côte d'Azur
This site is in the southeast of France
Located between the Southern Alps and the Mediterranean.
Here, you can find renowned cities such as Monte Carlo
Cannes,
and the Principality of Monaco.
Some of the sites you can visit are the Mercantour National Park,
The Marineland Theme Park, and the Monts d'Azur Biological Reserve.
These mountains offer hiking, horseback riding, mountain biking, and climbing.
No. 6 Loire Castles
In the center of France
You will get the Loire Castles
A very famous valley characterized by Renaissance-era structures
Surrounded by beautiful landscapes and gardens.
All the castles were built in the middle ages
And were declared a World Heritage Site in 2000 by Unesco.
There are more than 50 buildings among which Sully-sur-Loise
Chambord, Chenonceau, and Azay- le Rideau stand out.
And these castles are classified as royal, noble, and other castles.
You can also hire excursions so that you can get to know in detail
One of the most emblematic places in France.
No. 7 Lyon Cathedral
In the department of Lyon, you find will another of the emblematic churches of Europe
The Cathedral of St. John the Baptist of Lyon.
This Cathedral is better known as the Cathedral of Lyon.
Its name is from Primat des Gaules
And was built between 1180 and 1480
With a Romanesque and Gothic style that makes it unique.
In the apse, the oldest part of the church dating from the fifteenth century
You will see an astronomical clock from the fourteenth century.
You can see exceptional works such as the ivory chest from the 10th century
And the Byzantine portable altar from the 13th century.
You can also see Gothic elements in the chapel of the Bordones
No. 8 Mont Saint-Michel, Normandy
A magical island topped by a gravity-defying medieval monastery
Mont-Saint-Michel counts among France’s most stunning sights.
For centuries one of Europe’s major pilgrimage destinations
Tthis holy island is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, as is its breathtaking bay.
Modern-day pilgrims still make the journey here
Crossing the Bay of Saint-Michel by foot at low tide
Known as "The Heavenly Jerusalem" and the "Pyramid of the Seas,"
This little rocky islet off the coast of Normandy
Built between the 11th and 13th-centuries.
Today, it is one of the most visited places in France
Mont Saint-Michel welcomes approximately 2.5 million guests a year.
With over one thousand years of history under its belt
Who could blame anyone for wanting to experience this iconic island
No. 9 Palace of Versailles
One of the tourist places in Paris that you cannot miss is the Palace of Versailles.
Located in the Place d' Armen Versailles.
It is one of the most beautiful and visited monuments of the French capital.
The fame of this place came from its imposing architecture and gardens
That are part of the history of France.
It was declared a World Heritage Site by Unesco
And you can reach it by taking the train to Versailles with approximately seven euros.
No. 10 Les Calanques
One of the national parks in France is Les Calanques.
One of the largest natural areas with 8,300 hectares of land
And 43,500 hectares of water covering Marseille, Cassis, and La Ciotat.
It is a majestic place and one of the places to see in France that you cannot miss
Because you can see about 160 terrestrial species and about 60 marine species!
It is one of the most visited parks with two million visitors a year
The cliffs and the variety of flora and fauna will leave you speechless
Not to mention the beautiful views.
You can reach Les Calanques by train from Marseille
And the nearest station is three kilometers away.
You also have the option of going by car
Where you can park it without any problem in the vicinity of the park.
We suggest that you bring enough water
Shoes resistant to long walks, and sunscreen.
France is always a good option for traveling alone, as a couple, or as a family.
It has historic places, beautiful landscapes, and famous gastronomy
That you could never forget.
We encourage you to prepare your bags and visit France!
Surely, it is a country you can't miss.
What are you waiting for ?
Let yourself explore the magic that France has to offer
Remember that this country is beautiful in every of its corners
So make sure you enjoy it to the fullest!
That's it for now
